The "dUTP" stands for deoxyuridine triphosphate, indicating that it is a triphosphate version of deoxyuridine, suitable for incorporation into DNA.

Both of these compounds are used in molecular biology, for example, in techniques such as nick translation or as substrates for certain DNA polymerases that can incorporate these halogenated nucleotides into DNA.
